param.help: Path to the output model file Format: [output].h5

param.name: sele

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: target
param.label: target
param.help: Dependent variable you want to predict from your dataset. You can specify either a column name or a column index. Formats: { "column": "column3" } or { "index": 21 }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked. (Json)

param.name: validation_size
param.label: validation_size
param.help: Represents the proportion of the dataset to include in the validation split. It should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

param.name: window_size
param.label: window_size
param.help: Number of steps for each window of training model.

param.name: test_size
param.label: test_size
param.help: Represents the number of samples of the dataset to include in the test split.

param.name: hidden_layers
param.label: hidden_layers
param.help: List of dictionaries with hidden layers values. Format: [ { 'size': 50, 'activation': 'relu' } ]. (Json)

param.name: optimizer
param.label: optimizer
param.option: Adadelta - Adadelta optimization is a stochastic gradient descent method that is based on adaptive learning rate per dimension to address two drawbacks: the continual decay of learning rates throughout training and the need for a manually selected global learning rate

Adagrad - Adagrad is an optimizer with parameter-specific learning rates; which are adapted relative to how frequently a parameter gets updated during training. The more updates a parameter receives; the smaller the updates
Adam - Adam optimization is a stochastic gradient descent method that is based on adaptive estimation of first-order and second-order moments
Adamax - It is a variant of Adam based on the infinity norm. Default parameters follow those provided in the paper. Adamax is sometimes superior to adam; specially in models with embeddings
Ftrl - Optimizer that implements the FTRL algorithm
Nadam - Much like Adam is essentially RMSprop with momentum; Nadam is Adam with Nesterov momentum
RMSprop - Optimizer that implements the RMSprop algorithm

param.name: learning_rate
param.label: learning_rate
param.help: Determines the step size at each iteration while moving toward a minimum of a loss function

param.name: batch_size
param.label: batch_size
param.help: Number of samples per gradient update.

param.name: max_epochs
param.label: max_epochs
param.help: Number of epochs to train the model. As the early stopping is enabled, this is a maximum.

param.name: normalize_cm
param.label: normalize_cm
param.help: Whether or not to normalize the confusion matrix.
